description.zh-cn: 美国马萨诸塞州首府及最大城市，也是美国最古老的城市之一，在美国革命期间扮演了关键角色。
description.en: The capital and largest city of Massachusetts, USA. It is one of the oldest cities in the United States and played a key role during the American Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 波士顿的市政府机构，实行市长-议会制。
description.en: The municipal government of Boston, which operates under a mayor-council system.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，担任波士顿市长。
description.en: American politician, serving as the mayor of Boston.

description.zh-cn: 一个英国新教徒团体，其中一些成员于17世纪移民到新英格兰，并建立了波士顿。
description.en: A group of English Protestants, some of whom emigrated to New England in the 17th century and founded Boston.

description.zh-cn: 位于英格兰林肯郡的一个港口城镇，美国城市波士顿以此命名。
description.en: A port town in Lincolnshire, England, after which the city of Boston, USA, was named.

description.zh-cn: 位于波士顿的一所公立学校，是美国第一所公立学校。
description.en: A public school in Boston, and the first public school in the United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国第一所大学，由清教徒创立。
description.en: The first university in the United States, founded by Puritans.

description.zh-cn: 一场导致北美十三州从大不列颠王国独立的政治和军事斗争。
description.en: A political and military struggle that resulted in the independence of the Thirteen Colonies from the Kingdom of Great Britain.

description.zh-cn: 美国革命前夕发生在波士顿的标志性事件，英军士兵向平民开火。
description.en: A pivotal event before the American Revolution where British soldiers fired on civilians in Boston.

description.zh-cn: 美国革命前夕发生在波士顿的政治抗议活动，殖民者将英国东印度公司的茶叶倒入港口。
description.en: A political protest in Boston before the American Revolution, where colonists dumped tea from the British East India Company into the harbor.

description.zh-cn: 18世纪的欧洲强国，曾是北美十三州的宗主国。
description.en: A major European power in the 18th century and the sovereign state of the Thirteen Colonies in North America.

description.zh-cn: 在美国政治中具有重要影响力的爱尔兰裔美国家族，在波士顿政治中扮演重要角色。
description.en: An Irish-American family prominent in American politics, playing a significant role in Boston politics.

description.zh-cn: 2013年在波士顿马拉松赛终点线附近发生的恐怖袭击事件。
description.en: A terrorist attack that occurred near the finish line of the Boston Marathon in 2013.

description.zh-cn: 一家总部位于波士顿的个人护理产品公司，现为宝洁公司所有。
description.en: A personal care products company headquartered in Boston, now owned by Procter & Gamble.

description.zh-cn: 一家美国跨国消费品公司。
description.en: An American multinational consumer goods corporation.

description.zh-cn: 一支位于波士顿的美国职业棒球大联盟球队。
description.en: An American professional baseball team based in Boston.

description.zh-cn: 日本的一座城市，是波士顿的友好城市之一。
description.en: A city in Japan, one of Boston's sister cities.

description.zh-cn: 法国的一座城市，是波士顿的友好城市之一。
description.en: A city in France, one of Boston's sister cities.

description.zh-cn: 西班牙的一座城市，是波士顿的友好城市之一。
description.en: A city in Spain, one of Boston's sister cities.

description.zh-cn: 中国的一座城市，是波士顿的友好城市之一。
description.en: A city in China, one of Boston's sister cities.

description.zh-cn: 来自英国的清教徒移民于1630年创建了波士顿。
description.en: Puritan immigrants from England founded Boston in 1630.

description.zh-cn: 吴弭担任波士顿市市长。
description.en: Michelle Wu serves as the Mayor of the City of Boston.

description.zh-cn: 美国城市波士顿根据英格兰林肯郡的波士顿镇命名。
description.en: The US city of Boston was named after the town of Boston in Lincolnshire, England.

description.zh-cn: 清教徒于1635年创立了美国第一所公立学校波士顿拉丁学校。
description.en: The Puritans founded Boston Latin School, the first public school in the United States, in 1635.

description.zh-cn: 清教徒于1636年创立了美国第一所大学哈佛大学。
description.en: The Puritans founded Harvard University, the first university in the United States, in 1636.

description.zh-cn: 波士顿是美国革命期间多个重要事件的发生地，包括波士顿大屠杀和波士顿茶叶事件，这些事件推动了革命的进程。
description.en: Boston was the site of several key events during the American Revolution, including the Boston Massacre and the Boston Tea Party, which propelled the revolutionary cause.

description.zh-cn: 美国革命导致北美十三州脱离大不列颠王国独立。
description.en: The American Revolution led to the independence of the Thirteen Colonies from the Kingdom of Great Britain.

description.zh-cn: 肯尼迪家族作为杰出的爱尔兰裔代表，在波士顿政治中扮演了重要角色。
description.en: As prominent Irish-American representatives, the Kennedy family played a significant role in Boston politics.

description.zh-cn: 2013年波士顿马拉松爆炸案是一起发生在波士顿的恐怖袭击，造成人员伤亡。
description.en: The 2013 Boston Marathon bombing was a terrorist attack in Boston that resulted in casualties.

description.zh-cn: 吉列公司由宝洁公司拥有。
description.en: Gillette is owned by Procter & Gamble.

description.zh-cn: 吉列公司的总部位于波士顿。
description.en: Gillette is headquartered in Boston.

description.zh-cn: 波士顿红袜队是位于波士顿的美国职业棒球大联盟球队。
description.en: The Boston Red Sox are a Major League Baseball team based in Boston.

description.zh-cn: 波士顿与日本京都是友好城市。
description.en: Boston is a sister city to Kyoto, Japan.

description.zh-cn: 波士顿与法国斯特拉斯堡是友好城市。
description.en: Boston is a sister city to Strasbourg, France.

description.zh-cn: 波士顿与西班牙巴塞罗那是友好城市。
description.en: Boston is a sister city to Barcelona, Spain.

description.zh-cn: 波士顿与中国杭州是友好城市。
description.en: Boston is a sister city to Hangzhou, China.
